title: Israel-Hamas war: The faces of the massacre in Gaza
summary: The Israeli offensive in the Gaza Strip, designed to punish Hamas for its October 7 attack, has claimed almost 28,000 lives in four months, 70% of them women and children. Le Monde tells the stories of nine of these victims, aged between 3 and 70.

title: How far can Marine Le Pen's deputy, Jordan Bardella, go?
summary: The 28-year-old chair of the far-right Rassemblement National party has become a household name in French politics. He is more popular than his mentor Marine Le Pen, and some wonder: Would he dare turn against her?

title: French men are increasingly turning to vasectomy
summary: The number of men opting for this form of contraception has risen from 1,940 in 2010 to 30,288 in 2022, thus overtaking female sterilizations, according to a study.

title: Jordan king urges 'lasting' Gaza ceasefire in talks with Biden
summary: The US has consistently refused to call for a full ceasefire, saying that it backs Israel's drive to defeat Hamas, and calling for shorter pauses with hostage deals instead.

title: The anger and grief of the survivors of London's Grenfell Tower disaster
summary: Nearly seven years after the fire that claimed 72 lives, victims and relatives of the deceased got to tell their stories to those they hold responsible for the tragedy.

title: Five surprising creations spotted at Maison & Objet
summary: A stool made from banknotes and furniture carved from olive wood are among the curiosities at the Paris show that are shaking up the world of design.

title: France suspends subsidized electric car program after surge
summary: The French government said it was suspending the plan to lease electric cars from €100 a month after subsidizing more than double the number of vehicles planned for 2024.

title: France moves to end birthright citizenship in overseas Mayotte
summary: Interior Minister Gérald Darmanin promised a constitutional reform to make an exception to birthright citizenship in the Indian Ocean territory. The population has been protesting against a wave of illegal immigration.

title: France uncovers vast network of Russian disinformation sites
summary: One hundred and ninety-three fake news websites targeting both Ukraine and European countries, including France, Germany and Poland, have been identified. However, their audience seems limited.

title: Court orders Netherlands to stop delivery of F-35 parts to Israel
summary: The US-owned fighter jets parts are stored at a warehouse in the Netherlands and then shipped to several partners, including Israel.

title: What kind of work will be desirable in 2050?
summary: While it's easier to see what new technologies will destroy rather than what they will create, researchers are still trying to anticipate what work will be like in the future, writes Le Monde columnist Anne Rodier.

title: How 6-year-old Hind Rajab was killed as Palestinian Red Crescent tried to rescue her
summary: The child's cry for help had been widely broadcast as she was trapped under Israeli fire. The Red Crescent accused Israel of 'deliberately' targeting the ambulance sent to rescue her.

title: Finland elects pro-NATO Alexander Stubb as president
summary: Both a Europhile and NATO fan, the 55-year-old former prime minister and foreign minister is in favor of a 'more European' NATO.

title: Trump alarms allies by questioning NATO's solidarity
summary: The former American president said he was ready to 'encourage' Russian authorities 'to do whatever the hell they want' to any NATO country that did not contribute enough to the alliance's budget.

title: Rwanda plan incompatible with UK's rights obligations, British lawmakers warn
summary: The British Parliament's Joint Committee on Human Rights said in a new report that it had various concerns regarding the so-called Safety of Rwanda Bill.

title: The 'SAHG,' the girlfriend who patiently waits for her man to come home
summary: Anne Chirol reports on the digital archetypes of our time, from the #tradwife to the #fuckboy. This week, she focuses on the 'Stay at Home Girlfriend,' that homebody who doesn't work and is both emotionally and financially dependent.

title: Ukraine calls for Poland to 'punish' grain-spilling farmers as probe opened
summary: Polish farmers forcibly pried open Ukrainian trucks crossing into the European Union amid protests against what they see as cheap imports.

title: Tucker Carlson's Canadian stopover before his Moscow 'coup'
summary: The former Fox News star made a detour to Calgary, in the very conservative state of Alberta, in his role as influencer of a globalized far right.
